page.title: 13TILSTONE HALL FARM.
page.content: Tilstone Hall Farm is a{Mixed farm. It covers 250 acres, divided into l4 fields. {Mr. and Mrs. K. Lamb}are tenant farmers. They have 245 cows and followers, they also have 225 pigs which they rear for bacon. These are looked after by Mr. Lamb's daughter, Helen. The milk is collected by Bulk Tanker. Mr. Lamb goes to{Beeston {Cattle Market}every week to buy and sell his cattle and pigs. Mr. Lamb has four other workers to help him on the farm. The farm is owned by the {Leverhulme Estate. The{Milk Quota}for this farm is 876,000 litres per year. The farm stands near to the site of the former{Tilstone Hall}which stood in ruins for nearly a century and was finally demolished in l736. Near to the Hall,there are some ruins which are known locally as "The Chapel".
